questions.text: What keyword is used to declare a variable in JavaScript?
In ES6, what keyword is used to define a class in JavaScript?
What is the data type of the result of typeof operator for an array?
Which of the following statements is used to create a comment in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the Promise object in JavaScript?
choices: To represent a value that might not be available yet
questions.correctAnswer: To represent a value that might not be available yet

questions.text: Which array method is used to add elements to the end of an array?
What is the correct way to compare two values for equality in JavaScript?
How are objects created in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'let' keyword in JavaScript?
choices: To declare a variable with block scope
questions.correctAnswer: To declare a variable with block scope

questions.text: What is the 'constructor' method used for in a JavaScript class?
choices: To create an instance of the class

questions.text: Which of the following is a primitive data type in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'break' statement in JavaScript?
choices: To exit a loop or switch statement
To add elements to an array
questions.correctAnswer: To exit a loop or switch statement

questions.text: Which method is used to handle the rejection of a Promise in JavaScript?
What does the 'splice()' method do in JavaScript?
choices: Adds or removes elements from an array
Sorts the elements of an array
Reverses the elements of an array
questions.correctAnswer: Adds or removes elements from an array

questions.text: What is the difference between '==' and '===' in JavaScript?
choices: One is used for numbers, and the other for strings

questions.text: How do you access the value of a property in a JavaScript object?
What is the difference between 'var' and 'let' in terms of scope?
choices: 'var' has block scope, 'let' has function scope
'let' has block scope, 'var' has function scope
questions.correctAnswer: 'let' has block scope, 'var' has function scope
